alert.note: Alert for Central Interior (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 27 at 6:01AM AKDT until March 28 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow with freezing rain expected. Additional snow accumulations of up to 5 inches and ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Central Interior. * WHEN...From 6 AM Sunday to 6 AM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Ice could make travel hazardous. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow, strongest winds and worst visibility are expected over higher terrain north of the Tanana River. Freezing rain is expected today afternoon south of the Tanana River. The Parks Highway could see ice accumulation today. Freezing rain is expected to end late this evening.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet and ice are expected or occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
